duties_responsibilities.duty: Responsible for medical histories, patient monitoring, and diagnostic tests.
Performs patient risk assessment geared towards the relevant data needed pertinent to the patients radiologic exam.
Monitors patients under the care of the Supervising Physician during radiologic exams.
Recognizes and responds to medical emergencies (e.g., drug reactions, cardiac arrest, and hypoglycemia) and activates emergency response systems.
Verifies appropriateness of radiologic diagnostic procedures in accordance with criteria established by the Department of Radiology and the supervising physician.
Attends conferences as assigned.
Participates in the development and monitoring of patient outcomes per established practice protocols for purposes of quality and performance improvement.
Uses evidence-based health care literature to advise and support appropriate practice changes within the designated service.
Obtains and evaluates vital signs.
Reviews the patients medical record (including previous reports) to verify the appropriateness of a specific exam or procedure and report significant findings to radiologist.
Explains procedure to patient or significant others, including a description of risks, benefits, alternatives, and follow-up.
Documents any adverse occurrence, reaction, extravasation on department forms and in the computer.
Reports any adverse reaction to an Attending Radiologist and to the patient's referring Physician.
Recognizes and initiates treatment for anaphylaxis.
Able to recognize signs and symptoms of IV contrast reactions and respond to contrast reactions including and up to cardiovascular collapse.
Monitors patients during radiologic exams and responds to medical emergencies.
Participates in quality improvement activities within radiology practice.
Provides physician-prescribed post care instructions to patients.
Reviews imaging studies (diagnostic, US, CT, MR), makes initial observations and communicates observations only to the radiologist.
Operates a fixed/mobile fluoroscopic unit and evaluates images for completeness and diagnostic quality.
Performs certain procedures including contrast media administration and needle or catheter placement.
Administers contrast agents and radiopharmaceuticals as prescribed by the radiologist.
Monitors patient for side effects or complications of the pharmaceutical.
Ensures proper documentation of all procedures in the medical record.
Pursues a planned program of professional growth through continuing education conferences.
Serves as a clinical expert and resource for the education of peers and other health professionals.
Monitors and trends the cost effectiveness of the position.
Coordinates implementation of clinical research studies or clinical trials.
Assists in the preparation, implementation, and evaluation of research protocols when applicable.
Works collaboratively with nursing and other disciplines in the development and implementation of clinical studies within the area of expertise.

education_certification.credential: Graduate of an A.R.R.T. approved Registered Radiologist Assistant Program; current license by the New York State Department of Education as a Specialist Assistant in Radiology
